GameDBLocalizedString.Text: Minimally Invasive Excision
A surgical procedure performed through small incisions or natural orifices to minimize damage to surrounding tissues and reduce postoperative recovery time.
Restorative Filling
Removal of decayed tooth tissue, followed by filling the cavity with artificial materials (e.g., resin, alloy) to restore the tooth's shape and function.
Impacted Tooth Extraction
Surgical removal of a third molar that has failed to erupt normally and is causing or may cause damage to adjacent teeth or tissues.
Pericoronal Irrigation
Flushing the gingival pocket around a wisdom tooth with saline or antiseptic solution to remove food debris and bacteria, followed by local application of anti-inflammatory medication.
Sialolithotomy
Surgical incision of a salivary gland duct to remove a stone that is causing obstruction, inflammation, and pain.
Occlusal Splint Therapy

Fabrication of a removable dental appliance (occlusal splint) for the patient to relieve symptoms of temporomandibular disorder by optimizing the occlusal relationship and relaxing tense masticatory muscles.
Manual Reduction of TMJ Dislocation
A non-invasive procedure where a doctor uses specific manual techniques to guide the dislocated mandibular condyle back into the articular fossa, restoring normal jaw function.
Microvascular Decompression for Trigeminal Neuralgia

A precise neurosurgical operation involving a craniotomy to separate the blood vessel compressing the trigeminal nerve root under a microscope, thereby eliminating severe, electric shock-like facial pain.
Guided Tissue Regeneration

A periodontal surgery that uses a biocompatible barrier membrane over the root surface to guide the regeneration of periodontal ligament and alveolar bone cells, repairing bone defects caused by periodontitis.
Saliva Substitute Therapy
Providing patients with xerostomia with gels, sprays, or rinses containing moisturizing and lubricating agents to mimic the function of natural saliva and alleviate oral dryness.
Sistrunk Procedure

A surgical procedure specifically for excising a thyroglossal duct cyst, which involves removing the cyst, the entire thyroglossal duct tract, and a small portion of the hyoid bone to minimize recurrence.
Ankylosis Release Surgery
Surgical removal or separation of fibrous or bony tissue causing joint adhesion or fusion to reconstruct the joint space and restore mandibular mobility.
Comprehensive Orthodontic Treatment
Using fixed appliances (like brackets and archwires) or clear aligners to comprehensively realign all teeth, correcting malocclusion to achieve an aesthetic, functional, and healthy bite.
Orthognathic Surgery
Surgical correction of the relationship between the mandible and maxilla to improve occlusion and facial appearance.
Frenulotomy
Surgical removal or release of the lingual or labial frenulum to improve oral function or aesthetics.
